title: healthy control N1
extract_protocol_ch1: TRIzolTM LS reagent (Invitrogen Life Technologies) was used according to the manufacturer instructions for isolating total RNA.
label_protocol_ch1: After RNA isolation from the samples, the miRCURYTM Hy3TM/Hy5TM Power labeling kit (Exiqon, Vedbaek, Denmark) was used according to the manufacturer’s guideline for miRNA labelling. One microgram of each sample was 3'-end-labeled with Hy3TM fluorescent label, using T4 RNA ligase by the following procedure: RNA in 2.0 μL of water was combined with 1.0 μL of CIP buffer and CIP (Exiqon). The mixture was incubated for 30 min at 37°C, and was terminated by incubation for 5 min at 95°C. Then 3.0 μL of labeling buffer, 1.5 μL of fluorescent label (Hy3TM), 2.0 μL of DMSO, 2.0 μL of labeling enzyme were added into the mixture. The labeling reaction was incubated for 1 h at 16°C, and terminated by incubation for 15 min at 65°C.
hyb_protocol: After stopping the labeling procedure, the Hy3TM-labeled samples were hybridized on the miRCURYTM LNA Array (v.19.0) (Exiqon) according to array manual. The total 25 μL mixture from Hy3TM-labeled samples with 25 μL hybridization buffer were first denatured for 2 min at 95°C, incubated on ice for 2 min and then hybridized to the microarray for 16–20 h at 56°C in a 12-Bay Hybridization Systems (Hybridization System - Nimblegen Systems, Inc., Madison, WI, USA), which provides an active mixing action and constant incubation temperature to improve hybridization uniformity and enhance signal. Following hybridization, the slides were achieved, washed several times using Wash buffer kit (Exiqon), and finally dried by centrifugation for 5 min at 400 rpm.
scan_protocol: Hybridization signals were scanned and analyzed by Genepix 4000B microarray scanner. The scanned images were imported into the GenePix Pro 6.0 software (Axon Instruments) for grid alignment and data extraction. Replicated miRNAs were averaged, and the miRNAs with intensities in all samples were chosen to calculate the median normalization factor. The expressed miRNA data were normalized using the median normalization and chosen for the differentially expressed miRNA screening.
description: serum miRNA expression of OSCC patients from age, gender, smoking and drinking matched normal control people. The clinical characteristics of OCSS patients contain pathological grade, lymph node metastasis, TNM stage and survival status.
data_processing: The scanned images were imported into the GenePix Pro 6.0 software (Axon Instruments) for grid alignment and data extraction.Replicated miRNAs were averaged, and the miRNAs with intensities in all samples were chosen to calculate the median normalization factor. The expressed miRNA data were normalized using the median normalization and chosen for the differentially expressed miRNA screening.
data_processing.1: [Filtering criteria] We only analyzed the detected human related microRNAs. We excluded the probes of which signal intensity was less than 30.0 in all samples.

One microgram of each sample was 3'-end-labeled with Hy3TM fluorescent label, using T4 RNA ligase by the following procedure: RNA in 2.0 μL of water was combined with 1.0 μL of CIP buffer and CIP (Exiqon). The mixture was incubated for 30 min at 37°C, and was terminated by incubation for 5 min at 95°C. Then 3.0 μL of labeling buffer, 1.5 μL of fluorescent label (Hy3TM), 2.0 μL of DMSO, 2.0 μL of labeling enzyme were added into the mixture. The labeling reaction was incubated for 1 h at 16°C, and terminated by incubation for 15 min at 65°C.
hyb_protocol: After stopping the labeling procedure, the Hy3TM-labeled samples were hybridized on the miRCURYTM LNA Array (v.19.0) (Exiqon) according to array manual. The total 25 μL mixture from Hy3TM-labeled samples with 25 μL hybridization buffer were first denatured for 2 min at 95°C, incubated on ice for 2 min and then hybridized to the microarray for 16–20 h at 56°C in a 12-Bay Hybridization Systems (Hybridization System - Nimblegen Systems, Inc., Madison, WI, USA), which provides an active mixing action and constant incubation temperature to improve hybridization uniformity and enhance signal. Following hybridization, the slides were achieved, washed several times using Wash buffer kit (Exiqon), and finally dried by centrifugation for 5 min at 400 rpm.
scan_protocol: Hybridization signals were scanned and analyzed by Genepix 4000B microarray scanner. The scanned images were imported into the GenePix Pro 6.0 software (Axon Instruments) for grid alignment and data extraction. Replicated miRNAs were averaged, and the miRNAs with intensities in all samples were chosen to calculate the median normalization factor. The expressed miRNA data were normalized using the median normalization and chosen for the differentially expressed miRNA screening.

data_processing: The scanned images were imported into the GenePix Pro 6.0 software (Axon Instruments) for grid alignment and data extraction.Replicated miRNAs were averaged, and the miRNAs with intensities in all samples were chosen to calculate the median normalization factor. The expressed miRNA data were normalized using the median normalization and chosen for the differentially expressed miRNA screening.

One microgram of each sample was 3'-end-labeled with Hy3TM fluorescent label, using T4 RNA ligase by the following procedure: RNA in 2.0 μL of water was combined with 1.0 μL of CIP buffer and CIP (Exiqon). The mixture was incubated for 30 min at 37°C, and was terminated by incubation for 5 min at 95°C. Then 3.0 μL of labeling buffer, 1.5 μL of fluorescent label (Hy3TM), 2.0 μL of DMSO, 2.0 μL of labeling enzyme were added into the mixture. The labeling reaction was incubated for 1 h at 16°C, and terminated by incubation for 15 min at 65°C.
hyb_protocol: After stopping the labeling procedure, the Hy3TM-labeled samples were hybridized on the miRCURYTM LNA Array (v.19.0) (Exiqon) according to array manual. The total 25 μL mixture from Hy3TM-labeled samples with 25 μL hybridization buffer were first denatured for 2 min at 95°C, incubated on ice for 2 min and then hybridized to the microarray for 16–20 h at 56°C in a 12-Bay Hybridization Systems (Hybridization System - Nimblegen Systems, Inc., Madison, WI, USA), which provides an active mixing action and constant incubation temperature to improve hybridization uniformity and enhance signal. Following hybridization, the slides were achieved, washed several times using Wash buffer kit (Exiqon), and finally dried by centrifugation for 5 min at 400 rpm.
scan_protocol: Hybridization signals were scanned and analyzed by Genepix 4000B microarray scanner. The scanned images were imported into the GenePix Pro 6.0 software (Axon Instruments) for grid alignment and data extraction. Replicated miRNAs were averaged, and the miRNAs with intensities in all samples were chosen to calculate the median normalization factor. The expressed miRNA data were normalized using the median normalization and chosen for the differentially expressed miRNA screening.

data_processing: The scanned images were imported into the GenePix Pro 6.0 software (Axon Instruments) for grid alignment and data extraction.Replicated miRNAs were averaged, and the miRNAs with intensities in all samples were chosen to calculate the median normalization factor. The expressed miRNA data were normalized using the median normalization and chosen for the differentially expressed miRNA screening.

One microgram of each sample was 3'-end-labeled with Hy3TM fluorescent label, using T4 RNA ligase by the following procedure: RNA in 2.0 μL of water was combined with 1.0 μL of CIP buffer and CIP (Exiqon). The mixture was incubated for 30 min at 37°C, and was terminated by incubation for 5 min at 95°C. Then 3.0 μL of labeling buffer, 1.5 μL of fluorescent label (Hy3TM), 2.0 μL of DMSO, 2.0 μL of labeling enzyme were added into the mixture. The labeling reaction was incubated for 1 h at 16°C, and terminated by incubation for 15 min at 65°C.
hyb_protocol: After stopping the labeling procedure, the Hy3TM-labeled samples were hybridized on the miRCURYTM LNA Array (v.19.0) (Exiqon) according to array manual. The total 25 μL mixture from Hy3TM-labeled samples with 25 μL hybridization buffer were first denatured for 2 min at 95°C, incubated on ice for 2 min and then hybridized to the microarray for 16–20 h at 56°C in a 12-Bay Hybridization Systems (Hybridization System - Nimblegen Systems, Inc., Madison, WI, USA), which provides an active mixing action and constant incubation temperature to improve hybridization uniformity and enhance signal. Following hybridization, the slides were achieved, washed several times using Wash buffer kit (Exiqon), and finally dried by centrifugation for 5 min at 400 rpm.
scan_protocol: Hybridization signals were scanned and analyzed by Genepix 4000B microarray scanner. The scanned images were imported into the GenePix Pro 6.0 software (Axon Instruments) for grid alignment and data extraction. Replicated miRNAs were averaged, and the miRNAs with intensities in all samples were chosen to calculate the median normalization factor. The expressed miRNA data were normalized using the median normalization and chosen for the differentially expressed miRNA screening.
description: serum miRNA expression of OSCC patients from age, gender, smoking and drinking matched normal control people. The clinical characteristics of OCSS patients contain pathological grade, lymph node metastasis, TNM stage and survival status.
data_processing: The scanned images were imported into the GenePix Pro 6.0 software (Axon Instruments) for grid alignment and data extraction.Replicated miRNAs were averaged, and the miRNAs with intensities in all samples were chosen to calculate the median normalization factor. The expressed miRNA data were normalized using the median normalization and chosen for the differentially expressed miRNA screening.
data_processing.1: [Filtering criteria] We only analyzed the detected human related microRNAs. We excluded the probes of which signal intensity was less than 30.0 in all samples.
